name: ngxav-rs
title: ngxav: Comb through NGINX Logs at the Speed of Light
blurb: A multi-threaded, deep-search capable, full-featured, and intelligent NGINX log parser, written in Rust
points: Leverages several open source rust packages such as Rayon for threading to increase performance
Uses advanced profiling tools such as Flamegraph to improve performance and reduce memory usage
Written from scratch in Rust, using several Computer Science Mainstay Optimizations such as Dynamic Programming, Hashmaps, Threading/Parallelization, and Ownership
Uses Custom-Written Testing System to ensure peak performance and accuracy
Developmental Process Requires Use of Git, Cargo, Time, and Other Unix CLI Interfaces
Received Significant Traffic on Crates.io, Tested Daily Using Dogfooding

name: quail
title: Quail: Dual-LM, High-Accuracy QA Text Summarizer
blurb: Get Answeres Directly from the Source. Hallucination-Lite.
points: Uses innovative, self-designed Dual-LM approach, as published in Paper for TREC iKAT (see Resume for Paper Details)
Uses BERT & T5 based Langague Models to Rank Passage Sentences by Relevance Then Summarize
React based web app that calls Flask/Python Based API to Exchange Summary Metadata
Uses a Redis-Based Jobs System to Handle Queries to Avoid GPU Overloading
Uses HuggingFace Transformers, PyTorch, and CUDA with a self-hosted worker
Uses Docker to host API and PM2 to run worker

name: esteem
title: Esteem: Historical Weather Viewer
blurb: View over 70 years of weather. anywhere. 100% free.
points: React based web app that calls two apis to retrieve location and weather data
took steps to increase performance and reduce load times
optimized for SEO
used advanced methods to restrict API keys
used redis cache layer to store and serve data from downstream API with Redis and Flask
added blog feature using multi-layer blog post distribution system

name: locomotive
title: Locomotive: Amtrak Tracker
blurb: See Exactly How Late Your Amtrak Train Is
points: React-Native Based IOS and Android App
Uses Express.js API to serve train data
Followed App & Play Store Guidelines
Used Adobe Illustrator & Figma to Design Brand & User Experience
Received 1,000+ Downloads and dozens of daily users

name: density_matters
title: Density Matters
blurb: learn how changing the shape of your city can help change the course of climate change.
points: Uses RESTful APIs & Advanced React Components for an interactive experience
Mockups & Logos made in Adobe Illustrator
Fully Custom Mission-Focused CSS & UI/UX Design

name: cs_club_website
title: CS Club Website
points: Uses CSS & Javascript Based Animations
Uses Secure Methods to Authenticate Users by Password or by Google Login
Allows users to create, delete, and edit posts
Uses shell script and Express.js Backend to deploy static websites from Github
Involved Usage of Git CLI and Github CLI

name: marcmap
title: MarcMap
points: Uses Mapbox GL JS API to provide a user friendly map interface
Hosts Express.js Based Backend API to format GTFS-RS Data
Required Use of Performance Performance and Testing Tools
Involved use npm & node in creating and deploying API
Required Extensive SEO optimization and use of Analytics
Designed, Developed, and Published an IOS Version written Swift/SwiftUI to the Apple App Store
App Received 1,000+ App Store Downloads and dozens of daily users

name: chess
title: Chess
blurb: A 21st century take on a 6th century game
points: Uses GameCode system to allow seemless multiplayer between anyone in the world
Hosts Express.js Based Backend API facilitate moves between clients and MySQL Server
Required use of ES6 Syntax and Asynchronous Functions
Involved use npm & node in creating and deploying API
Required detailed knowledge of HTTP Post and Get Requests

name: Composite
title: Composite
blurb: College comparison tool with a focus on equity.
points: Implements Data from the US Department of Education
Sourced from a live database
Written in JavaScript using the React Framework
Uses Open-Source Libraries for Graphing
Involved Usage of Git CLI and Github CLI
Optimized for Accessibility

name: Caldata
title: Caldata
blurb: Learn about the countries' biggest state.
points: Implements Data from the Californian Goverment and Climate Researchers
Sourced from live and local databases
Written in JavaScript using the React Framework
Data Analysis Conducted with Node.JS
Required SVG-Implementation
Involved Usage of Git CLI and Github CLI
Optimized for Accessibility

name: school_webscraper
title: Lunch Emailer
points: Uses the Requests Library to Read HTML Lunch Menu
Interprets iCal Links and Finds Current Data
Evaluates Performance Metrics
Uses Unix Time Stamp to Handle Date/Time
Hosts IMAP & SMTP Server to Automatically Send HTML-Formatted Emails
Involved Usage of Git CLI and Github CLI
